title: Fedspeak Cheat Sheet: What Fed Officials Said Before Their December Meeting
body: Federal Reserve officialsâ€™ comments took a decidedly hawkish turn in the weeks following the Federal Open Market Committee meeting in early November that launched the drawdown of central bank bond buying. A number of policy makers, including Chairman Jerome Powell, have flagged the possibility that the Fed would speed up its tapering process at its Dec. 14-15 meeting and end it in the spring. Officials are worried about high levels of inflation and want their bond-buying effort wrapped up to give them space to raise their near-zero short-term interest-rate target if surging prices continue.
